Bruce Banner.Action: Kills an arctic fox with a gunshot while in emotional anguish.
Shows visible anguish and emotional pain before the act.
Takes off his parka in the freezing cold, exposing himself too much, then aims a gun at himself, thumb pulling back the hammer despite the anguish visible.

Despite his emotional turmoil and apparent intent to shoot himself, his Hulk transformation reflexively catches the bullet in his palm, demonstrating physical capability but indicating a loss of conscious control or planning.
Greets a shop-owner he’s friendly with at the market.
Walks anonymously through the favela without engaging beyond necessary.
Remains calm and composed when the instructor slaps and shoves him repeatedly during training, nodding to acknowledge the test and later carefully tending to his bleeding cheek.

Declines manager’s offer for better pay with a smile and shakes his head, despite getting hurt.
Works on fixing a machine's electrical issue, opening the back of an on/off button box and repairing frayed wires while bottles move beneath on the conveyor belt.

Compares a white substance brought by a delivery driver against a marked page in his worn book, shows interest and makes a transaction, indicating knowledge and skill in identifying or valuing what the driver brings.

Cuts his hand while responding to the manager, causing blood to drip on the moving bottles, indicating a momentary carelessness or distraction.

Keeps moving past a pretty woman who smiles at him, smiling back but remaining distant, suggesting possible social withdrawal or reservedness, not directly related to competence but may indicate lack of engagement.

Applies crazy glue to a cut on his hand to treat it immediately and continue working.
